text:
Q: How can I call one shell script from another shell script? A:

First you have to include the file you call:

#!/bin/bash
. includes/included_file.sh

Then you call your function like this:

#!/bin/bash
my_called_function

Q: How make just one Main method without “Program has more than one entry point defined” in Nunit testing (ASP.NET Core project, Visual Code) A:

I created asp.net core project - dotnet new web api - in Visual Studio Code (there were even no debugger support with c# extension for x86 system). Then I needed to implement Nunit tests. I created with dotnet new nunit command in one of project folder along with controller, repository, models folder.

Dotnet projects should each be in their own directories in the filesystem. They should never be nested. An example of a directory structure for a simple two project solution would be something like...

c:\dev\solution  
c:\dev\solution\webApiProject
c:\dev\solution\webApiProject.Tests

inside the webApiProject folder I would run dotnet new webapi inside the webApiProject.Tests folder I would run dotnet new nunit

if you run both of those dotnet new commands in the webApiProject folder or any of its subfolders what you end up with is the files from both templates in the same directory, which would lead to the error mentioned in the title.

Q: Can PowerShell automatically create missing directories when redirecting output? A:

Out-File (>) doesn't create folders if they don't exist by itself, however with New-Item you can create the folder and write to a file in that new folder all in a single line if you use -Force, for example:

'hello world' | New-Item .\missing_dir\git_status.txt -Force
Get-Content .\missing_dir\git_status.txt # hello world

Using its alias for a shorter expression you should be able to do:

git status | ni .\missing_dir\git_status.txt -f

Q: Clear cache Laravel automatically A:

If you want automatic and consistent caching for your Eloquent queries, you can use the package Smart Cache:

https://github.com/ibra379/smart-cache

It provides a simple API like Model::smartCache()->smartGet() that transparently caches query results and automatically invalidates the cache whenever the model changes.

No need to manage cache keys or use Cache::remember() manually — everything is handled for you.

Q: How to open Picker menu when a button is pressed A:

The reason why you are not seeing the round button for the picker is because of the modifier .labelsHidden(). However, it sounds like you don't want a button + picker, you only want a...

microphone button which, when pressed, should open the Picker menu for macOS SwiftUI

This is in fact how a Menu works. So the problem can be solved by wrapping the Picker with a Menu. You can then style the menu button.

The answer to MacOS, SwiftUI - styling Picker button (menu type) shows how this can be done using a custom ButtonStyle (it was my answer). You might want to consider doing it the same way. But it can also be done without factoring out the styling into a separate ButtonStyle:

  1. Wrap the Picker with a Menu.

    • The label that you were using for the Picker can become the label for the Menu instead.
    • Supply a simple string label to the Picker as a replacement.
    • The modifier .labelsHidden() should remain on the Picker.

  2. Change the picker style to .inline.

  3. Apply the style .buttonStyle(.plain) to the Menu.

// DevicePickerButton

var body: some View {
    Menu {
        Picker("Microphone", selection: $selectedDeviceID) {
            // ... picker contents as before
        }
        .pickerStyle(.inline)
        .labelsHidden()
    } label: {
        pickerLabel
    }
    .buttonStyle(.plain)
    .frame(width: 58, height: 58)
    .onHover { hovering in
        if hovering {
            hoverTrigger += 1
        }
        isHovering = hovering
    }
}
